title: Component-driven Design
description:
Design a component-based design system for a mid-to-large scale product: buttons, inputs, tabs, banners, dialogs, and more. Focus on how the system is structured, how teams consume it, and how it evolves safely over time.

Key considerations:
- Token-driven theming: color/spacing/typography tokens, semantic vs raw tokens, and how themes (light/dark/high-contrast/brand variants) are applied.
- CSS architecture: using CSS variables, BEM/utility classes, or a utility framework (e.g. Tailwind-style tokens) in a way that stays maintainable as the system grows.
- Accessibility-first component APIs: keyboard behavior, ARIA attributes, focus management, and how props/events/slots are designed to encourage accessible usage by default.
- Dark mode, high contrast, and RTL support built into tokens, components, and layout primitives.
- Versioning and breaking changes: how to ship updates, deprecations, and migrations to multiple consuming apps without chaos.

You should be ready to talk about: consistent component APIs (props, events, slots), how to organize packages/modules so that tree shaking works well, how to keep bundle size under control (code splitting, on-demand imports, side-effect-free modules), and how to ensure long-term maintainability across many teams and products.
